channel.title: A small, clean base?
channel.description:
Hey, I'm sorry that my first post is an inquiry/request but I'd like to get started and I wasn't sure where to post.
I used the search feature, but I would like some recommendations.
:o -
I'm not looking for a link to a flashy server with features and custom shit.
I just would like a base to get started on.
Best way to get the hang of this is to do the most I can myself.
Same goes for client, just a blank basic client to use.
[b]Note:[/b] I searched through the forums and looked at many of the sources and clients posted for public use, yet they're riddled with features I'd just end up removing anyway.
[b]Q:[/b] [i]"why not just make your own from scratch noob?"[/i] [b]A:[/b] I'd love to lol, that's what I plan to do anyway. The more work I put into it's creation, the more I'll understand towards fixing it and improving upon it. There are some things that make that process easier though, like a simple basic layout.
Once again, I'm incredibly sorry if this is yet another irritating post for those of you here who know your shit already. I'm simply looking forward to getting the hang of it and contributing what I can to the community. I have no desire to leech and leave.
Thank you!
:)

item.title: A small, clean base?
item.dc:creator: @Dragroxas Dragroxas
item.description:
@Dragroxas wrote:

For the Source i Recommend All-Star Scape v2 Even though a lot of people hate it but, it really is good just make sure you don’t extract the tools folder… that has a Trojan in it but if you do you can just delete the tools folder. Its an old Trojan were Mod All-Star would come and hack your server and steal it but just delete tools folder (the virus is Shop Maker).

For the Client i recommend Kihomura’s 317 Client it is very very basic no custom and no viruses…

To get them just use search NOTE: Deltascape is not good source!!!

Read full topic

item.title: A small, clean base?
item.dc:creator: @TabbyKiller TabbyKiller
item.description:
@TabbyKiller wrote:

Ok i know your new here and thats good that you
are supporting mopar by registering. But just so you
know theres a download section here

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars


(can also be found on the index page)
here http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php

Umm well for your requirment i suggest iClarity BLANK SERVER!!
which can be downloaded here.

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars

The dude accually made a blank server. Well not from scratch just
by editing other source’s and stuff.

Well as the staff of moparscape had already said “welcome”

And have fun.

item.title: A small, clean base?
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“Tribe, post:7, topic:266545”][quote author=Yz85Racer link=topic=352021.msg2700769#msg2700769 date=1236579056]
It’s Java you twat. It’s multi-platform, wdf r u on about.
[/quote]

Oops, silly me. What I ‘meant’ to say in that post was:

I dislike Vista, I’m too lazy to duel-boot, or downgrade to XP. I blame struggles or errors with things I download or install on the Vista OS as opposed to acknowledging that the problem is most likely caused by my ignorance to the Vista OS and it’s pretty features.

I assume your reply was only directed at the fact that I claimed your shit didn’t work with Vista. Would you care to reply again with suggestions/recommendations of resources to use?

I’m still wondering what Client to use.

If I make my own, will I have to worry about my obvious lack of intelligence getting in the way of it connecting with the base source I decided to use?

Is there a specific client you suggest I use?

Do these beginner questions make you rage?

Do you see me as an irritating leeching fag who should be shot, stabbed, skullfucked and then drowned in boiling apple sauce?

I’m sure you know which of those questions I’d appreciate the answers to.

Help a twat. You know you want to.

:)[/quote]
After reading that post, a few things come to mind what I would like to do this ‘twat’. Few I could say here. Anyway, perhaps downloading JRE? http://java.com/en/download/manual.jsp

Read full topic

item.title: A small, clean base?
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“Tribe, post:5, topic:266545”]The rules are sticky for a reason, why waste my own effort on a post that doesn’t follow them?

Thanks for the help, I’ve checked out the sources you’ve suggested. I’m very interested in Yz’s base, although I’m having some trouble with Vista. So I’ll work on that later.

Also, regarding a client. I saw the huge list of features involved with DeltaScape’s source (I also read the posts by people struggling to get it to work, I think that anti-leech is genious! :D)

I’m sure with a server as ‘filled’ as that would require a great client, which I don’t have.

Do you have any suggestions for a client and source that either go together, or are mutually clean? So any features I add I’ll make sure work with the client?

P.S. The organization with Rs2dv seems amazing, so I’m eager to try and get that to work on Vista.

Also, check Windows Live messenger Chassy13. [My apologies for being off topic]

So far I’m most interested in Yz’s and Rs2dv based, DeltaScape looks fantastic, but I would appreciate the features in it far more if I had made them work myself. This is a learning experience for me mostly.[/quote]
It’s Java you twat. It’s multi-platform, wdf r u on about.

Read full topic

item.title: A small, clean base?
item.dc:creator: @Tribe Tribe
item.description:
@Tribe wrote:

The rules are sticky for a reason, why waste my own effort on a post that doesn’t follow them?

Thanks for the help, I’ve checked out the sources you’ve suggested. I’m very interested in Yz’s base, although I’m having some trouble with Vista. So I’ll work on that later.

Also, regarding a client. I saw the huge list of features involved with DeltaScape’s source (I also read the posts by people struggling to get it to work, I think that anti-leech is genious! :D)

I’m sure with a server as ‘filled’ as that would require a great client, which I don’t have.

Do you have any suggestions for a client and source that either go together, or are mutually clean? So any features I add I’ll make sure work with the client?

P.S. The organization with Rs2dv seems amazing, so I’m eager to try and get that to work on Vista.

Also, check Windows Live messenger Chassy13. [My apologies for being off topic]

So far I’m most interested in Yz’s and Rs2dv based, DeltaScape looks fantastic, but I would appreciate the features in it far more if I had made them work myself. This is a learning experience for me mostly.

item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:

Finally, a non-idiotic new member that actually read the rules(hopefully) and searched before asking a question…

Anyway, Project Czar and DeltaScape aren’t the most stable, but they are basic sources.

item.title: A small, clean base?

item.description:
@Tribe wrote:

Oh yes, I’ve taken a look at Rs2dv and Yz’s stickies, they both look very useful. I’ll look into Project Czar and DeltaScape as well.

Thank you very much for the recommendations!

item.title: A small, clean base?
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

You can use rs2dv, Yz’s base, project czar, or DeltaScape. Those are some of the most basic sources I know.

Read full topic

item.title: A small, clean base?
